result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James S Bax

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James S Bax in court.  Attorney Joshua Patrick Grube in court for James S Bax.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Parties are still negotiating. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Defense request to Judge Koss from Atty. Grube
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.addlTxt:
3:10 PM (64-06) Defendant James S Bax in court.  Attorney Joshua Patrick Grube in court for James S Bax.  Attorney J.J. Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney Grube acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his Client.
Speedy reserved.

Defendant is to be booked and printed by the end of the week.

Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adj. 3:13PM

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James S Bax in court.  Attorney Joshua Patrick Grube in court for James S Bax. Rights given and hearing requested. Time period waived for preliminary hearing. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 131807,
Payable Number: 263960,
Receipt Number: 22R 008577,
Amount: $20.00
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  K.M.A. dob 11/25/75, J.D.H. dob 11/15/88, A.L.W. dob 5/7/1991, C.J.C. dob 3/2/1997.Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

8:35am Court in session

Defendant James Bax present in court with attorney Joshua Grube, specially. ADA Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Record by the State, State filed new charges for bail jumping based on referral that Deft was intoxicated & got into another bar fight in IL, Deft charges in IL with aggravated battery. 
Deft does have representation in IL on that case. State notes there are multiple victims 
Atty Grube takes a minute to go over complaint, asking for adjourned initial appearance to see if Atty Grube is formally retained. 

Court will set a new bond on the new file
